revised_title: The Extraordinary Life and Discoveries of John Rae
tldr: This biography tells the story of John Rae, an extraordinary explorer and surgeon who covered vast distances on foot and by canoe, mapping unknown territories and leading expeditions for the Hudson's Bay Company. Despite facing challenges and criticism, Rae made significant discoveries, including the fate of Sir John Franklin's ill-fated expedition. His contributions to science and geography are celebrated through various topographical features named in his honor.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Arctic Exploration
